publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3143 Chris Ballance: 60th Anniversary of Hiroshima—That the Parliament observes the 60th anniversary of the first nuclear attack on Japan at Hiroshima on 6 August 1945; is gravely concerned about the global proliferation of nuclear weapons, including the current development of uranium enrichment in Iran; believes that nuclear proliferation will not be prevented unless all countries disarm, and therefore calls on the UK Government to abide by the terms of the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and to set an example by announcing that it intends to abandon its plan to replace the United Kingdom’s Trident nuclear weapons.

S2M-3143 60th Anniversary of Hiroshima (lodged on 5 August 2005) Campbell Martin*, Patrick Harvie*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Shiona Baird*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rosie Kane*, Bill Butler*, Mark Ballard*, Robin Harper*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Tommy Sheridan*, Margo MacDonald*, Eleanor Scott*, Marlyn Glen*, John Swinburne*
S2M-3143 60th Anniversary of Hiroshima (lodged on 5 August 2005) Linda Fabiani*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Frances Curran*, Richard Lochhead*
S2M-3143 60th Anniversary of Hiroshima (lodged on 5 August 2005) Elaine Smith*
